skill.name: theme-factory
skill.description: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme. These artifacts can be slides, docs, reportings, HTML landing pages, etc. There are 10 pre-set themes with colors/fonts that you can apply to any artifact that has been creating, or can generate a new theme on-the-fly.

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL Anthropic skill containing only documentation files (markdown) with theme definitions. No executable code, no external dependencies, and no security concerns.

content.user_title: Theme Factory: Professional Styling for Presentations & Documents
content.value_statement: Instantly apply professionally-designed color palettes and font combinations to your presentations, documents, and artifacts with 10 curated themes or create custom ones on demand.
actual_capabilities: Apply 10 pre-designed professional themes to artifacts (slides, docs, HTML pages)
Display visual theme showcase via PDF for easy selection
Provide complete theme specifications including hex color codes and font pairings
Generate custom themes on-the-fly based on user requirements
Ensure consistent styling across all elements of an artifact
limitations: Limited to specified font families (DejaVu Sans, DejaVu Serif, FreeSans, FreeSerif)
Requires manual application of theme specifications to artifacts
Cannot automatically detect or suggest themes based on content analysis
Custom theme generation depends on quality of user input description

use_cases.title: Professional Business Presentation
use_cases.description: Apply the Ocean Depths theme to a corporate quarterly review presentation for a professional, trust-building appearance

use_cases.title: Creative Marketing Pitch
use_cases.description: Style a product launch deck with Sunset Boulevard theme for vibrant, energetic visuals that capture attention

use_cases.title: Environmental Report
use_cases.description: Use Forest Canopy theme for sustainability reports and environmental presentations to reinforce natural, eco-friendly messaging

use_cases.title: Tech Startup Demo
use_cases.description: Apply Tech Innovation theme to software demos and product showcases for a modern, cutting-edge aesthetic

use_cases.title: Custom Brand Theme
use_cases.description: Generate a custom theme matching specific brand guidelines when none of the preset themes align with brand identity

prompt_templates.title: Apply Theme to Existing Presentation
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a presentation about [topic]. Can you show me the theme showcase and help me apply a theme that fits [professional/creative/modern] style?
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have an artifact that needs styling

prompt_templates.title: Create Custom Theme
prompt_templates.prompt: None of the preset themes work for my [type of content]. Can you create a custom theme that feels [warm/cool/energetic/calming] and works well for [audience/industry]?
prompt_templates.scenario: When preset themes don't match your needs

prompt_templates.title: Theme Recommendation
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm creating a presentation for [audience] about [topic]. Which theme would you recommend and why?
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need guidance on theme selection

prompt_templates.title: Consistent Multi-Document Styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the [theme name] theme to all my project documents - the presentation, the report, and the landing page - to ensure visual consistency.
prompt_templates.scenario: When working with multiple related artifacts

output_examples.input: Apply Ocean Depths theme to my investor pitch deck
output_examples.output: A presentation styled with Deep Navy (#1a2332) backgrounds, Teal (#2d8b8b) accents, Seafoam (#a8dadc) highlights, and Cream (#f1faee) text using DejaVu Sans Bold for headers and DejaVu Sans for body text

output_examples.input: Create a custom theme for a children's education app presentation
output_examples.output: A new theme with playful, bright colors (primary blues and yellows), readable sans-serif fonts, and high contrast for accessibility, with a name like 'Playground Colors'

best_practices: Always show the theme-showcase.pdf first to let users visually compare options
Wait for explicit user confirmation before applying a theme
Ensure proper color contrast ratios for readability when applying themes
Maintain consistency by applying the same theme across all related artifacts
When creating custom themes, ask clarifying questions about mood, audience, and industry
Read the full theme specification file before applying to ensure all details are captured
anti_patterns: Applying a theme without showing the showcase or getting user confirmation
Mixing elements from multiple themes in a single artifact
Ignoring accessibility considerations like contrast ratios
Modifying the theme-showcase.pdf file instead of just displaying it
Creating custom themes without understanding the user's specific requirements

faq.question: How many themes are available?
faq.answer: There are 10 pre-designed professional themes, plus the ability to generate unlimited custom themes based on your specific needs.

faq.question: What types of artifacts can I style with these themes?
faq.answer: You can apply themes to presentation slide decks, documents, reports, HTML landing pages, and any other visual artifact that supports custom colors and fonts.

faq.question: Can I customize the preset themes?
faq.answer: While you can't modify the preset themes themselves, you can create a custom theme inspired by a preset theme with your specific adjustments.

faq.question: What fonts are available?
faq.answer: The themes use DejaVu Sans, DejaVu Serif, FreeSans, and FreeSerif font families, which are widely available and support good readability.

faq.question: How do I choose the right theme?
faq.answer: Start by viewing the theme-showcase.pdf to see all options visually. Consider your audience, industry, and the mood you want to convey. Each theme description includes 'Best Used For' guidance.
